title: The Bachelor's Elly Miles reveals she had a breast enlargement
text:
She's the lovable country girl who instantly became a fan favourite on this year's season of The Bachelor.

And Elly Miles has made the surprising revelation that she underwent a breast enlargement shortly before her debut on the show.

During a Q&A video on her YouTube channel, the 25-year-old confessed: 'Yes, I've had them done. I had them done September 4, 2018.'

'The girls are one year old': The Bachelor's Elly Miles (pictured) has revealed she underwent a breast augmentation before going on the show

She added: 'Just over a year ago. The girls are one year old!'

Elly also revealed that she decided to get Botox injections in preparation for her appearance on The Bachelor.

'I got Botox just before going on because I could see in photos that I had four very distinct lines, and my makeup would set into it,' she said.

She explained that her bad eyesight causes her to squint and this created lines on her forehead.

Revealed: During a Q&A session uploaded to YouTube, Elly admitted: 'Yes, I've had them done. I had them done September 4, 2018.' Pictured: Elly in August 2018

She added: 'When I was 18 or 19, my friend who is a beauty therapist said to me, "You need Botox", and I was like "F**k you, no I don't"... and I did need Botox.'

It comes after Elly opened up about struggling with body confidence issues after watching herself on the Channel 10 reality show.

Taking to Instagram earlier this month, she wrote: 'Changing my mindset has been the best thing I could've done for myself and my happiness in the last few months!'

'I did need Botox': Elly (pictured) also revealed that she decided to get Botox before appearing on the show because she had 'four very distinct lines' on her forehead

She added: 'I was feeling all kinds of sad and would look in the mirror and put myself down. It's so important to love the skin your in - at all stages of life!

'It's very easy in today's society to get wrapped up in how your body should look and compare yourself to others. I can't stress enough how important it is to have realistic goals!'

She concluded: 'Own yourself, own your body - and love it! At the end of the day, a lot of us are so lucky to have a healthy, functioning body.'
